intro: Polyalthia coriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tree or Indian chestnut, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural and ecological purposes.
